title: Review Roundup For The Super Mario Bros. Movie
description:
The Super Mario Bros. Movie seems to land halfway up the flagpole critically, with the animated movie from Nintendo and Illumination earning mixed results. The presentation of the Mushroom Kingdom gets high praise, but the plot--or lack thereof--keeps reviewers from going wahoo.

That may not matter for the commercial success of the movie, though. The Super Mario Bros. Movie is eyeing a $225 million opening weekend worldwide, which would put it in prime position to become the highest-grossing video game film of all time. Warcraft currently holds the crown at $439 million worldwide.

Mario voice actor Chris Pratt believes The Super Mario Bros. Movie won't ruin your childhood because it's "fantastic" in his eyes. And, to be fair, the first reactions to the film were pretty positive, albeit even then people pointed out the formulaic narrative.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: MLB The Show 23 Best Batting Stances To Use
description:
When creating your own custom player in MLB The Show 23, you are quickly presented with numerous choices regarding how your player will look and act--one of the most important being your batting stance. Aside from the overall appearance of your player, which can look just like you using the facescan option, the more important choices like this one lie in the other options on the "Create a Player" screen. After you are done customizing how your player will look, you are immediately given the option to create or choose a batting stance and animation.

Players who decide to create their own batting stance will be given an almost overwhelming number of options to choose from. There's the hand rotation, hand waggle rotation, and the back elbow offset settings that all need to be adjusted, among a plethora of others. For those who might not want to mess with these settings themselves, you are also able to choose a batting stance from a list of generic stances, as well as those from current and former players. This is where most players will be drawn, as it allows you to simply pick a batting stance with existing settings.

However, choosing an existing batting stance comes with its own set of challenges. Certain stances affect your overall contact and power as well as your swing animation and position of the bat. If you're looking for the best overall batting stances that give you the highest chance to knock in some runs and don't require much maintenance, we have you covered. Below, you can see our picks for the five best batting stances in MLB The Show 23.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Ark: Survival Evolved Reviews Trending Negative On Steam After Paid Upgrade Announcement
description:
Ark: Survival Evolved has been receiving negative reviews on Steam since developer Studio Wildcard announced that it will be releasing a paid upgraded version of the game called Ark: Survival Ascended. Studio Wildcard also announced that all official servers for the original version of Ark: Survival Evolved will shut down in August, with the option to migrate saves to the new upgraded version.

Players on Steam have taken issue with the Unreal Engine 5 version of the game, because Studio Wildcard is charging for the upgrade and closing the official servers for the original version. It's important to note that players can still operate their own servers in Ark: Survival Evolved, but all of the official servers are being migrated to Ark: Survival Ascended. This also includes the servers for the Xbox One and PS4 versions of the game, despite Ark: Survival Ascended only releasing on current-gen consoles and PC.

One player with nearly 10,000 hours in Ark: Survival Evolved left a negative review, citing the server wipes and paid upgrade path. Another player left a negative review, simply stating that the game closing in August and the developer selling the game with all of the DLC again was unacceptable.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Shigeru Miyamoto Dodges "When's The Next Mario Game?" Question In Style
description:
Shigeru Miyamoto inevitably gets asked when the next Mario game is during promotions for The Mario Super Bros. Movie, and he always has coy answers ready.

During a Variety interview, after the interviewer asks when we can expect the next Mario game, Miyamoto replies, "Please stay tuned for future Nintendo Directs."

Does that mean a Nintendo Direct in the near future, or a Nintendo Direct next year? Or perhaps the year after? No one knows. It's a perfect deflection. Miyamoto was asked a similar question during an IGN interview, and he replied, "Nintendo is always working on Mario."

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Latest The Last Of Us Part 1 PC Hotfix Addresses Crashes, UI, And "Unintended Character Behavior"
description:
The Last Of Part 1 on PC has received yet another hotfix looking to address a number of issues ranging from crashes to "unintended character behavior."

In the official patch notes, Naughty Dog encourages players using Nvidia 30-series graphics cards to update their drives to version 531.58, and includes a message "directly from Nvidia'' that says players using GeForce RTX 30 series GPUs may encounter random crashes.

The hotfix itself looks to address other instances of the game crashing, which have been a major complaint among PC users on Steam, where the game currently sports "Mixed" user reviews. Naughty Dog notes that the hotfix addresses UI/UX issues, unintended character behavior for both playable characters and NPCs, and includes additions to diagnostic support. Below are additional fixes listed in the patch notes.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Super Mario Bros. Movie Review - Actually Awesome
description:
Folks have been having all sorts of emotional turmoil about this new Super Mario Bros. Movie since the moment it was announced that Guardians of the Galaxy and Lego Movie star Chris Pratt would provide the voice of Mario. All that gnashing of teeth was for nothing, though. The Super Mario Bros.. Movie is both pretty funny and also just plain pretty--this movie is a feast for the eyes.

This adventure begins in Brooklyn, with a pair of brothers whose family plumbing business is--despite a stellar local TV ad featuring the Super Mario Bros.. Super Show theme--struggling. A brother-and-brother plumbing outfit? In this economy? Forget about it.

Fortunately, these normal-life problems are pretty quickly forgotten when Mario and Luigi venture deep into the sewers to try to figure out why Brooklyn's streets are spontaneously filling with water. They discover a weirdly intricate structure that goes deep underground, but before they can explore it fully, Mario steps into the wrong pipe and is transported to the Mushroom Kingdom.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Miyamoto Has No Problem With Violent Games But Mario Won't Wield A Gun Anytime Soon
description:
Mario creator Shigeru Miyamoto has said he has nothing against violent video games, but no one should expect the next Mario game to be an M-rated shooter or anything like that. No one ever realistically expected this to happen, of course, but it's fun to hear Miyamoto talk about his design philosophy and why he wants to keep Mario a family friendly series.

Speaking to Variety, Miyamoto said his own personal quest is to find ways to make games fun and exciting that doesn't require putting a gun into the character's hand.

"I want to make it clear that I am not against shooter games and violent games," he said. "There are many mediums that entertain people, but I think it is my mission to find other ways to make an interesting and fun game. I told myself that Mario is a character that never hurts other people, so I wanted to find a different way of expressing Mario."

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Amazon Lays Off Around 100 Games Division Employees, But Game Dev Teams Will Expand
description:
Around 100 Amazon employees working in its gaming divisions have been laid off, with the cuts affecting those working at the company's San Diego development studio, as well Prime Gaming and Game Growth divisions.

Amazon Games vice president Christoph Hartmann, in a memo to employees (via Bloomberg), said that going forward, Amazon will "continue to invest in our internal development efforts, and our teams will continue to grow as our projects progress."

Hartmann said remaining employees at Amazon's San Diego studio will "double down" on pre-production of a currently unannounced project, and that the company's Montreal-based development studio, which is working on another unannounced project, will expand.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Call Of Duty's Newest Anti-Cheat Tool Can Tell When You're Using Banned Hardware
description:
Activision has released new anti-cheat tools for the Call of Duty series that can detect when third-party hardware devices are attached to a person's setup.

In a blog post, Activision said such devices can give players the ability to gain an unfair advantage by way of reducing or completing eliminating weapon recoil, among other things. Following a testing period, Activision has now deployed the new hardware detection update in Modern Warfare II and Warzone 2.0. Anyone suspected to be cheating by way of a third-party hardware device on PC or console will see a warning page (see below) before potentially more serious action is taken.

Anyone who continues to use such devices after the warning could face harsher penalties like an additional warning, "mitigations," an account suspension, or a total ban.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Ana De Armas' John Wick Spin-Off The Ballerina Targets June 2024 Release
description:
John Wick spin-off The Ballerina--starring Ana de Armas--is reportedly planned for a June 2024 release (via Deadline). The latest John Wick movie has made a killing at the box office raking in a global box office of $250M. That takes the franchise to a worldwide gross of $833M over four films.

De Armas, coming off her Oscar nomination for Netflix's Blonde, is no stranger to action movies, having already starred in No Time To Die alongside Daniel Craig in his final outing as James Bond. The actress will play an assassin trained in the traditions of the Ruska Roma like Reeves' Wick. Ian McShane is looking to return as hotel owner Winson as well as Anjelica Huston reprising her character The Director from John Wick 3. Gabriel Byrne, Catalina Sandino Moreno, and Norman Reedus have been cast in unspecified roles.

Rumors were speculated with John Wick 4 that Ana's character, Rooney, appeared during the scene of Bill Skarsgard's Marqui watching a lone ballet performance with a single star on stage. Rooney was briefly seen in John Wick 3, albeit played by a different actor and without any lines.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: It's A Barbie World With 24 New Movie Posters
description:
We're just three months away from Greta Gerwig's Barbie movie, with Oscar nominee Margot Robbie taking on the role of the iconic toy. After dozens of animated movies, fans will enter Barbie's world in her first live-action feature. On Tuesday, 24 character posters premiered showing the entire main cast full of Barbies, Kens, and even some humans.

Barbie has had many careers spanning decades, including a veterinarian to even an astronaut and President of the United States. The posters confirm the actors who had been announced and the Barbie, or Ken, that they're playing in the movie. Insecure's Issa Rae will play President Barbie and Dua Lipa will swim as mermaid Barbie, who has her series of spin-off movies as well.

As for the Kens, we get Ryan Gosling, Simu Liu (Shang-Chi), the future Doctor Who Ncuti Gatwa, and Scott Evans (Looking, Fringe). There's even Allan, played by Michael Cera, who is a discontinued doll introduced as Ken's friend.

The movie has been in the works since 2009 and is finally set to premiere in theaters on July 21.


Margot Robbie as Barbie


The original. Seen in her trademark ponytail and a striped bathing suit that was introduced with the doll back at the 1959 New York Toy Fair. Mattel has sold over a billion Barbie dolls, making it the company's largest and most profitable line. Robbie was cast back in 2019 and also serves as one of the movie's producers.


Hari Nef as Doctor Barbie


The former Transparent star shows off a new look with red hair and a prismatic dress. Doctor Barbie was first introduced in 1973 and packaged with an x-ray image, her diploma, a labcoat, a stethoscope, a head mirror, and her teal rotary phone.


Kingsley Ben-Adir as Ken


The former Peaky Blinders and One Night In Miami star is a Ken.


Dua Lipa is Mermaid Barbie


The Mermaid Barbie franchise has been a successful series of straight-to-video movies and toyline. The first Mermaid Barbie was a Gold Label collector item designed by Linda Kyaw and released in 2012. The Gold Label designated the doll as a collector's item with 4,300 made.


Emma Mackey as Nobel Prize Winner Barbie


While Barbie doesn't have a Nobel Prize doll--yet--three dolls are focused on science. There's the astrophysicist Barbie that comes with a telescope, star map, and galaxy print top. The other two are Lab Scientist as part of the career line and simply "Scientist" with blue hair, but both come with microscopes.


Scott Evans as Ken


Yup, Chris Evans' younger brother is a Ken! While not dressed as any particular Ken doll, Evans is donning a look that seems to be a mix of Cowboy Ken and the long-forgotten Campus Hero Ken attire.


Ana Cruz Kayne as Supreme Court Justice Barbie


Introduced in 2019, the Judge Barbie line was released for Barbie's Career of the Year. "The Barbie Judge Doll encourages girls to learn more about making decisions to change the world for the better," Mattel said at the reveal.


Sharon Rooney as Lawyer Barbie


The Scottish actress is playing a Barbie first. Lawyer Barbie was never an official doll, but an outfit part of the Cool Career fashion line. There were Elle Woods dolls released as part of the Legally Blonde tie-in, but nothing official as part of the Barbieland careers. How else did she become a judge though?


Emerald Fennell as Midge


Midge's history is pretty interesting and maybe one of the most in-depth character profiles in all of Barbieland. Margaret "Midge" Hadley Sherwood was introduced in 1963 around the same time as Barbie's cousin, Skipper (who is so far absent from the movie).

Midge was marketed as Barbie's best friend and later revamped as part of the Happy Family line and was sold as "pregnant" as seen in the poster. Her daughter Nikki as a newborn baby was also released as well.


Alexandra Shipp


The former X-Men and Tick, Tick, Boom actress is playing another not-quite-official Barbie. It'll be interesting to see what kind of books Barbie is known for.


Michael Cera as Allan


There's only one! Not to be confused with Midge's partner Alan, Allan with two L's was created as Ken's best friend. Ken's buddy came with the notable feature of being the same size as Ken so all of Ken's clothes fit him as well.

The last Allan doll was released almost 10 years ago as part of the Double Date 50th Anniversary Giftset.


Ritu Arya as Pulitzer Winner Barbie


The Umbrella Academy star and drummer is another non-canonical Barbie, but the company did celebrate the life of Ira B. Wells. Wells, a Black American journalist, suffragist, and anti-lynching crusader had her likeness transformed into a Barbie doll last year.


Ncuti Gatwa as, yes, a Ken


The future Doctor Who takes his fashion cues from Western Stampin' Ken, a doll released in 1993. However, with the guitar, Gatwa could also be some sort of Country Duet Ken, which was part of a set with Barbie featuring a Grand Ole Opry diarama.


Kate McKinnon as Barbie


This Barbie has seen better days. We've all seen dolls tattered with awful haircuts and crudely applied makeup. These dolls were treated as art projects for toddlers and given not exactly the best ensembles.


Ryan Gosling as Ken


Gosling plays the original Ken, Ken Carson, who was created in 1961, just two years after Barbie. Ken was named after Kenneth Handler, son of Barbie creator Ruth Handler, just as Barbie was named after her daughter, Barbara.


Nicola Coughlan as Diplomat Barbie


The Bridgerton Star is yet another new Barbie for the film. She is seen in something reminiscent of the rare Fab City outfit with her shawl and gloves from 1969.


Simu Liu as Ken


The Kim's Convenience and Shang-Chi star looks to be Gosling's top rival for the film. The first Asian Ken Doll was released in 2010. The doll is also known as Samurai Ken and was designed by Linda Kyaw.


Issa Rae as President Barbie


President Barbie actually has a few variations going back to 1992 in her red, white, and blue taffeta gown. Since then she's scaled back her looks taking on a more modest approach to presidential fashion sticking to pencil skirts and pantsuits. Rae will be the first Black President Barbie.


Will Ferrell as CEO of a toy company


We're still really not quite sure of Ferrell's purpose aside from him being a nameless toy company CEO. The poster simply just says to call him mother.


Connor Swindells as toy company Intern


Another human that Barbie meets when she and Ken travel to the real world, the Sex Education star plays a toy company intern.


America Ferrera as a human woman


Her role is still undisclosed and we haven't gotten a lot of information about her character, but the former Ugly Betty star shines in her solo poster.


Jamie Demetriou as a suit


Another business-type character with an unknown role, the comedian and Fleabag actor is looking super serious in his featured poster.


Ariana Greenblat as another human


The youngest star of the movie, Greenblat (young Gamora in Avengers: Infinity War) plays a human girl in the real world.


Helen Mirren as the narrator


Every good story needs a great storyteller. Oscar-winning actress Helen Mirren provides the narration of Barbie's story while in Barbieland. Through her, we get to know these characters and what they're all about.

title: Players Banned From PGA Tour In Real Life Are In EA's New PGA Tour Video Game
description:
Now that EA Sports PGA Tour is available through early access, the game's player roster has come to light--and it contains some major surprises. The roster of playable characters includes numerous golfers who have been banned from the PGA Tour in real life over their decision to leave the PGA Tour and join the controversial Saudi-backed LIV Golf series.

LIV players featured in EA Sports PGA Tour include Dustin Johnson, Joaquin Niemann, Bryson DeChambeau, Brooks Koepka, Harold Varner III, Bubba Watson, Abraham Ancer, and Ian Poulter.

Many might have assumed that these players would not show up in EA Sports PGA Tour due to their affiliation with Greg Norman's LIV Golf tour, but that is not the case for whatever reason. GameSpot has contacted EA Sports in an attempt to get more details.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Leon Kennedy Suplexes His Way Into Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 Thanks To Mods
description:
With the Resident Evil 4 remake launching to rave reviews, Leon Kennedy is once again in the spotlight of the gaming world. Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 modder tabs_mvc decided now was the best time to add the RE4 hero to the crossover fighter, and the results are impressive.

The modder posted a minute-long teaser video for Leon on Twitter, which shows him fighting against the likes of RE villain Nemesis, as well as Morrigan from Darkstalkers. His super moves include the use of the famous Resident Evil rocket launcher, as well as a flurry of knife attacks followed by a German suplex worthy of WWE.

i still don't like him but 4make was tight as hell so, here we are pic.twitter.com/kPi1wuwbdq

— tabs (@tabs_mvc) April 4, 2023

Tabs's version of Leon appears to borrow much of his moveset from fellow Resident Evil protagonist Chris Redfield, but there are many crucial differences that set Leon apart into his own character. The long-range rifle attack allows Leon to juggle an opponent with multiple shots, while the knife attack can reflect projectiles with the right timing--something Chris was never able to do.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Monster Energy Once Again Threatening Legal Action Over A Game's Title
description:
Monster Energy might be popular among video game players, but the people who make games might have a different opinion, especially if they want to include the word "monster" in their game title. According to developer Vincent Livings, Monster Energy's lawyers are coming after his studio Glowstick Entertainment because of the title of its game, Dark Deception: Monsters & Mortals.

1. It's well known that @MonsterEnergy is a notorious trademark troll. Unfortunately, they're at it again. For a company that likes to target their drinks at gamers, they also like to try to bully & bankrupt game studios with lengthy high dollar litigation. #indiegamedev #gamedev pic.twitter.com/8xvg7iWqQe

— Vincent Livings (@VincentLivings) March 29, 2023

Livings has apparently decided to fight Monster Energy's claims, saying that he disagrees with the company's stance that the word "Monster" will confuse players into thinking that the energy drink is related to the game. He also shared legal communications from Monster Energy, including what appears to be an agreement that would prevent Glowstick from ever making a game with Monster in the title, or selling any product that uses the colors green, white, or black.

Reposting these terms from Monster Energy since journalists are referencing this thread. pic.twitter.com/AUD1sT2q9H

— Vincent Livings (@VincentLivings) April 4, 2023

This isn't the first time that Monster Energy has gone after a game developer for this specific issue. Ubisoft's Immortals: Fenyx Rising was originally marketed under the name Gods & Monsters, and it's been alleged by some that the name change was due in part to legal action from the beverage company. For its part, however, Ubisoft claimed in an interview with GameSpot that the name change came because the team behind the game wanted to put more emphasis on the main character.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Super Mario Bros. Movie Eyeing $225 Million Worldwide Opening
description:

title: This New Xbox Controller Is Made Of Recovered Plastics Like Old CDs And Plastic Jugs
description:
Microsoft has announced a new Xbox controller design, and this one is unlike anything the company has created before. Ahead of Earth Day later this month, Microsoft has revealed an Xbox controller made of recovered plastics called the Remix Special Edition controller.

The controller is made up of Xbox One first-generation controller parts that have been ground up into a raw material and then used, in part, to create a new controller. Also mixed in are "post-consumer recycled resins," Microsoft said in a news release.

These include reclaimed materials from car headlight covers, plastic water jugs, and CDs. The controller sports Earth tones for its color scheme, inspired in part by the green lichen found in the Pacific Northwest of the US where Microsoft has its headquarters.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Quantum Break May Stay On Xbox Game Pass After All (For Now)
description:
Before Remedy arrived back on the scene with the supernatural thriller Control, the studio teamed up with Microsoft to release an ambitious TV/game crossover titled Quantum Break in 2016. And though that game was recently listed as "leaving soon" alongside other titles on the Game Pass app, it seems that it will remain on the service for now.

Xbox published a blog post today that listed the games leaving Game Pass on April 15, and Quantum Break was not mentioned. Every other game shown in the "leaving Game Pass" page earlier this week is confirmed to be leaving the service, including The Riftbreaker, Moonglow Bay, Rainbow Six Extraction, The Dungeon of Naheulbeuk: The Amulet of Chaos, Life is Strange: True Colors, and The Long Dark. That same blog post listed Iron Brigade, Ghostwire: Tokyo, and Minecraft Legends as upcoming additions to Game Pass, among others.

It's unclear if this means that Quantum Break is still on the chopping block for later this year, or if the exclusive is here to stay. German-language outlet Xbox Dynasty reported that Microsoft told the outlet that the removal is due to licensing issues, but it's unclear what the nature of those issues are. It's worth noting that Quantum Break would not be the first Xbox exclusive to be removed from Game Pass, as several previous Forza titles have been pulled due to music licensing deals expiring.

title: Google Adds Retro Easter Egg To "Super Mario Bros. Movie" Searches
description:
The Super Mario Bros. Movie hits theaters tomorrow, and you may be wondering if your local theater still has tickets for the film's opening weekend. If you decide to turn to Google when you begin your ticket search, there's a nifty little Easter egg waiting for you.

Along with information you expect to see while searching for "Super Mario Bros. Movie"--cast, showtimes, etc.--a small NES-era question block will appear at the top of the page next to the movie's name. Clicking on it will make a coin appear, along with the signature 8-bit coin sound, and every 100 clicks will get you a 1-Up.

This isn't the first time Google has tossed gaming-related Easter eggs onto its search pages. A search for "The Last Of Us," for instance, will produce a red mushroom button that slowly "infects" the screen with cordyceps as you click on it, while the Google logo changed to a playable version of Pac-Man in celebration of the game's 30th anniversary.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Shrek 5 With Original Cast Is Seemingly Coming Together, But Don't Get Too Excited
description:
Shrek 5 has been the subject of ongoing rumor and speculation for some time, and now the head of animation studio Illumination has said the movie actually happen. CEO Chris Meledandri, who is a creative partner for Shrek studio DreamWorks, told Variety that it is his hope that Mike Meyers (Shrek), Eddie Murphy (Donkey), and Cameron Diaz (Fiona) return for Shrek 5 to reprise their characters.

"We anticipate the cast coming back," Meledandri said, though he cautioned that it's still early days and no deals have been signed as of yet. "Talks are starting now, and every indication that we've gotten is there's tremendous enthusiasm on behalf of the actors to return."

Meledandri, who oversaw The Super Mario Bros. Movie, said the situation with Shrek is not that dissimilar to Mario in that the idea is to take "core elements" that audiences love about a property and try to honor those with a new installment.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Xbox Game Pass Losing These 7 Games Soon
description:
As it does each month, Microsoft removes titles from the Xbox Game Pass library. The next wave of removals has now been announced, and there are seven titles headed out on April 15.

Of note, Microsoft's own console exclusive, Quantum Break, is not among the list of titles set for removal despite the game appearing in the "Leaving Soon" section of the Xbox Game Pass app. GameSpot is currently attempting to understand what it happening with Quantum Break.

As for games that are confirmed to be leaving Game Pass soon, subscribers have until April 15 to play Life is Strange: True Colors, Moonglow Bay, Panzer Corps, and Rainbow Six Extraction. The Dungeon of Naheulbeuk, The Long Dark, and The Riftbreaker also leave Game Pass that day.

title: 37% Of People Who Started LOTR: Rings Of Power Finished It, According To A Report
description:
According to a new report, The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power had a relatively low viewership completion rate in the US, but Amazon Studios believes the show is a success that will grow further for Season 2 and beyond.

The Hollywood Reporter cited data suggesting that 37% of people in the US who started The Rings of Power did not finish all of the episodes in Season 1. The site said a completion rate of 50% is considered good but not great. Outside of the US, The Rings of Power got closer to that, reaching about a 45% completion rate among viewers, THR said.

The report did not include any further specifics about viewership for The Rings of Power. According to Amazon, the series was seen by 100 million people. The creative team has five seasons mapped out, including the very last shot. Season 2 is currently filming in the UK, and Season 3 should be officially announced this year.

description:

description:

Braytech Werewolf is a classic weapon that usually drops as a reward during Destiny 2's Festival of the Lost Halloween event, and if you have it in your collection, you can reacquire it with some excellent curated perks.

What makes this auto rifle so deadly in PvP is Zen Moment, as causing damage with this weapon reduces recoil and flinch over time. Combined with its excellent range, and as tested by True Vanguard, Braytech Werewolf becomes a medium to long-distance monster that can invade a territory usually dominated by pulse and scout rifles.

title: Pokemon Stadium Joins Nintendo Switch Online N64 Lineup April 12
description:
Pokemon Stadium--the Pokemon franchise's first-ever jump from portable to home-based consoles--is coming to the Nintendo Switch Online library of N64 games April 12.

Pokemon Stadium lets players battle in both single-player challenges like the Gym Leader Castle and multiplayer modes like the minigame-focused Kids Club. The game features all 151 Pokemon from the Red/Blue/Yellow era, as well as trainers from the inaugural Pokemon adventure.

The single-player modes will let players build a team with stock Pokemon each with its own moveset and stats. The import feature from the original launch--where those who played the Game Boy games could import Pokemon from the handheld to the console--will not carry over to the Nintendo Switch Online version.

title: New Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse Trailer Has Miles On The Multiverse Run
description:
The second official trailer for Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse has swung in, and like the teaser before it, it's a showcase of Spider-Men from across the Marvel Multiverse, a brewing civil war, and Miles on the run from the Spider-Man of 2099, Miguel O'Hara.

Picking up shortly after the first film, Into the Spider-Verse reunites Miles with Gwen Stacy, but after being introduced to a team of Spider-People charged with protecting the very existence of the Multiverse, Miles finds himself at odds against the other Spiders and he must redefine what it means to be a hero if he wants to protect the people that he loves the most.

title: Harry Potter TV Series For HBO Max Moves Ahead, JK Rowling Reportedly On Board
description:
It's still very early days and there is no confirmation that a show will ever be made, but Deadline reports that a Harry Potter TV series for HBO Max is moving forward with a major development. The site reported that author JK Rowling--who controls the creative decisions of the series--is nearing a deal to produce the show. The show could span seven seasons, each focusing on one of the books.

"Once she comes on board, the project, which is in nascent stages, is expected to look for a writer. As first reported by Bloomberg, the general idea is for each season of the potential TV series is to focus on one book in the Harry Potter book series, which consists of seven novels," Deadline said.

There has been talk of a new Harry Potter TV series for some time, but this newest development seems to suggest it could actually happen. Nothing is confirmed, though. There is no word on casting, plot, or a release date for the rumored series, and WB has yet to confirm any official details.
